title: Registry Persistence
description:
During a forensic analysis of a Windows system, you find this registry entry:

Key: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run
Value: SecurityUpdate
Data: C:\Users\Public\svchost.exe

The real svchost.exe lives in C:\Windows\System32\. This entry is a persistence mechanism.

What is the common name for this malware technique of adding entries to the Run key to survive reboots?

Submit as: flag{technique_name} (lowercase, underscores)
hints: The Run key executes programs automatically at user login
MITRE ATT&CK tracks this as technique T1547.001
The technique name combines the registry location with the goal (persistence)
